chapter.title: Selective Dissemination of Information
chapter.para: Selective Dissemination of Information (SDI) is a documentation watch tool.

sect2.title: Definition
sect2.para: Selective Dissemination of Information is a service that consists in routing to readers, on a regular basis, news alerts corresponding to their readers' profiles. It is a documentation watch tool. SDI makes it possible to inform readers of new acquisitions on particular subjects or issues.
One can equally refer to it as a "documentation profile" or a "personalized profile" or even a "search profile".

sect2.title: SDI Private and Public
sect2.para: Selective Dissemination of Information makes it possible to alert readers about new publications or news relative to their fields of interest, enabling them to stay current. SDI allows the constant knowledge update of a user or user group. The update is carried out by routing the most recent references on a regular basis. There are two types of Selective Dissemination of Information :

listitem.para: one is the supply of bibliographical references corresponding to the profile of only one user: the service is then strictly "individual", that is, a "personalized profile". They are the private inboxes of PMB.

the other is the supply of bibliographical lists of a more general coverage corresponding to the fields of interests of a homogeneous group of users. This is a "group profile" which generally triggers various "standard profiles" to be put forward. They are the public inboxes of PMB.

sect2.title: Displaying the SDI tab
sect2.para: If SDI is not activated, you will not see the SDI tab of PMB. To activate, in Administration, Tools, Parameters, Selective Dissemination of Information, set active to 1.
Warning the user of PMB must have the proper access privileges to access the SDI tab. In Administration, Users, Edit, check SDI for one or more users.
For more information on configuring PMB, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide. In order to help you set the SDI, here is the list of the related parameters :

sect2.title: SDI and OPAC
sect2.para: Authenticated readers will be able to see SDI in the OPAC. To activate SDI in the OPAC, modify the parameter values in Administration > Tools > Parameters, OPAC type, section Options relating to SDI.

sect2.title: Routing
sect2.para: Routing is the last stage of SDI. Once one or more baskets are created, and equations are placed in them, you can route alerts.
Automatic routing displays both public and private inboxes at the same time.

sect2.title: Inboxes
sect2.para: You can manage your inboxes here. Inboxes are reservoirs of new materials. It is their contents that will be routed to readers. Here you can add, edit or delete an inbox. You can also create equations for supplying the inbox and add readers to whom new acquisitions lists are destined.

sect2.title: Equations
sect2.para: Equations are in fact selected advanced search strategies used for filling up inboxes

sect2.title: Options
sect2.para: Define here filing systems for your equations and inboxes.

sect2.title: SDI : step-by-step use
sect2.para: SDI tab : - Equations, management, click on Add to create a search equation.
and start a search, for example :
When the results are displayed, click on "Transform into SDI equation"
Give a name to the equation then Save it

Note : at any time you will be able to modify a search equation, making it possible to modify, add or remore search criteria to the equation. Display the various search equations and click on an equation to modify it.
Inboxes, public, add : give a name to the inbox, check automatic inbox, frequency (1 e.g.), number of records (50 e.g.), choose a category of readers and check routing by email. Save
When you change a category of readers, a Javascript alert opens on the screen. This alert enables you to immediately update readers' subscriptions.
Click on the inbox, in the column "related equations" to assign one or more equations to the inbox.
Assigning equations to an inbox : check the equation, save.
Click on Subscribers to choose any and Save.

figure.title: List of inboxes after assigning equations and subscribers

sect2.para: Then procedd to edit a record corresponding to your search equation -
SDI, Routing, Automatic, Next : check your inbox, click on fill. The number of records has changed.

figure.title: List of inboxes to carry out an action

sect2.para: You can then route.

figure.title: Result of an action carried out

sect2.para: Obviously your readers must have an email address to receive the contents of the inbox by mail. The email opens on the screen in a popup.
Warning the address of your SMTP server must be defined in your PHP configuration.

figure.title: Sending the contents of an inbox to subscribers

sect2.para: Readers can see the inbox contents as they connect to the OPAC.

Reader's fiche display in the OPAC
When you click on "Access your customized information", you can see the inboxes to which you subscribe.

figure.title: Reader's fiche in the OPAC, after clicking on "Access your customized information"

sect2.para: As with any record in the OPAC, you can either expand it by clicking on the button "+" or display it by clicking on its title. Possibilities depend on the parameters of the OPAC bannette_notices_depliables. For more information, consult the PMB Administrator's Guide.

sect1.title: Private SDI
sect1.para: Private SDI is available with PMB 2.1 stable release.

It allows any authenticated reader to create a personal "documentation profile". The profile enables him/her to stay current with new acquisitions of the library or resource centre corresponding to his/her fields of interest.
Caution Personalized SDIs created in the OPAC are visible at one place only in the PMB management interface: DSI > Inboxes > private
Private SDI inboxes are not listed.
The routing of private SDIs are necessarily automatic.
Private equations are not managed from the PMB SDI tab.
Private SDIs are organized as follows :

listitem.para: a reader creates a private inbox (no classification possible)
the reader can assign only one search equation to the inbox (assigning several search equations to one private basket is not possible, different inboxes must be created)
the inbox will be reserved for this reader only and cannot be routed

sect2.title: Routing
sect2.para: Routing is the last stage of SDI. Once one or more baskets are created, and equations are placed in them, you can route alerts.
Automatic routing displays both public and private inboxes at the same time.
